intro: Astragalus davidii var. acutidentatus, commonly known as the sharp-toothed milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-white flowers clustered in dense racemes. The plant has pinnately compound leaves with serrated or lobed leaflets, and its roots are often fibrous and taproot-like. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or gravelly soils. This species is part of the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing capabilities and ecological importance in soil enrichment.
